usefulItems: parchment paper, pastry brush, baking sheet, oven
title: Cheddar and Walnut Scones with Onion Jam

ingredients.content: 16 oz red onions, cut into half moons (¼ in.)
3 oz cheddar cheese, cut into pieces
8 oz all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
3 oz whole milk, plus extra to brush

preparations.content: Place onions, sugar, vinegar, wine, raisins, bay leaves, cinnamon and cloves into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>45 min/212°F//speed 1<b>.
Add salt, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>15 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely.
Preheat oven 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place cheese, walnuts and rosemary into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place flour, baking powder, salt, cayenne, mustard powder, egg, milk and olive oil into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved cheese mixture and mix a further <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and pat or roll into a circle about 1½ inches thick. Cut dough into 6 equal wedges. Place scones onto prepared baking sheet.
Brush scones with milk and bake 12-15 minutes (425°F) or until golden brown. Serve warm with reserved Onion Jam.
